intro: Lomatia elegantissima, commonly known as the elegant lomatia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves that are often divided into narrow, lance-shaped segments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
